snippet: When a production moves to a Broadway house, it can seem different — even if the script, director and actors haven’t changed.
abstract: Plays that move from smaller venues to the Broadway stage can often seem different, even if the scripts, directors and actors all remain the same; many of the shows currently on Broadway began in Off Broadway productions or outside of the New York theater entirely.
lead_paragraph: When a production moves to a Broadway house, it can seem different — even if the script, director and actors haven’t changed.

headline.seo: ‘Once’ and Other Shows That Moved to Broadway
headline.main: Shows You See Again, for the First Time
headline.print_headline: Shows You See Again, for the First Time
